tool.name: MUSCLE
tool.description: MUltiple Sequence Comparison by Log- Expectation
tool.command: muscle ##Do not display progress messages -quiet -in $input_seqs #if $mode.run == "custom" : -maxiters $mode.iterations #else: -maxiters $mode.run #end if -cluster1 $cluster $diags -${outputFormat.value}out align.out -htmlout ${out_align_html}

param.name: run
param.label: Run options
param.help: The number of iterations is predefined to allow to select between accuracy or speed options
param.option: Compromise options for large datasets, maxiters=2

param.name: iterations
param.label: Maximum number of iterations (-maxiters)
param.help: Increase the quality, increase the computing time

param.name: diags
param.label: Find diagonals (-diags)
param.help: Use diagonal optimization. This can significantly improve speed with closely-related sequences.

param.name: cluster
param.label: Clustering (tree-building) options
param.help: Algorithm use to build guide trees for progressive alignment

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**MUSCLE version 3.8.31, 2004**
-----
========== Overview ==========
MUSCLE is a program for creating multiple alignments of amino acid or nucleotide sequences. A range of options is provided that give you the choice of optimizing accuracy, speed, or some compromise between the two.
-----
For further informations, please visite the MUSCLE_ website.
.. _MUSCLE: http://www.drive5.com/muscle/
**Basic usage:**
muscle -in *inputfile* -out *outputfile*
**Common options (for a complete list please see the User Guide):**
:-in: *inputfile* Input file in FASTA format (default stdin) :-out: *outputfile* Output alignment in FASTA format (default stdout) :-diags: Find diagonals (faster for similar sequences) :-maxiters: *n* Maximum number of iterations (integer, default 16) :-html: Write output in HTML format (default FASTA) :-phys: Write output in Phylip sequencial format (default FASTA) :-phyi: Write output in Phylip interleave format (default FASTA) :-clw: Write output in CLUSTALW format (default FASTA) :-quiet: Do not write progress messages to stderr
